Wow, what a delightful find! No wonder it's always booked up. As a person who knows Martha's Vineyard fairly well, I don't think I would stay anywhere else than here. Staying in Vineyard Haven is a great choice because it's a stone's throw from the ferry and within walking distance to excellent cafes, coffee shops, book shops, and art galleries. When the name of the game is parking, you definitely want a solid home base that has plenty around it within waking distance.
I loved this location because Gerda was extremely attentive (and so interesting!) and I loved her style- very sharp white and black checks with sparkling clean white bathrooms and lovely white bedclothes. Additionally, her little kitchenette was the perfect size for cooking a little something on her tiny ceramic stovetop or microwave oven, but more importantly, perfect for reheating your leftovers from your delicious Vineyard restaurants :). I couldn't believe I found such a place and will definitely be coming back with my significant other.
We were able to ride all around to the best places, so definitely centrally located. 25 minutes from Menemsha fish market for lobster rolls, 5 minutes from downtown Oak Bluffs (carousel, campground, and Offshore Ale Co.), 15 minutes from Edgartown for a lovely dinner at the Harbor View. She encouraged us to spend more time "Up-island" (Chilmark, West Tisbury, Aquinnah) to check out the Sherriff's Meadows conservation lands, and we sure will!

review_text:
My wife and I stayed at Gerda's apartment for a few days of our honeymoon during our first trip to Martha's Vineyard and loved it! It was just what we needed for the two of us. The apartment honestly looks better than the pictures (the pics are great but I couldn't tell the full layout ahead of time. We were pleasantly surprised when we got there). For starters, Gerda's apartment is super close to the ferry. We drove and it took us about 3 min to get there but for visitors walking it's also super close. The good thing about MV is that no matter where you are, everything is really close to get to from this apartment and even the furthest towns are 20-30 min away (driving). We also got to MV in the morning and were able to check in by noon! This was great and Gerda sent us good morning messages each day. As for pros & cons of the apartment:
Pros
- Close to everything (shops, brunch restaurants, beaches, etc)
- Quiet at night even though it's by a lot of shops. We also didn't feel like things were super busy around us.
- Comfortable bed
- Great living room, bathroom, & shower
Cons
- There's a key for the apartment door but you aren't allowed to lock the door downstairs that leads into the building from outside. (This wasn't really a con for us because we felt safe the whole time but might be an issue for some guests. Not sure what the reason is behind this but it would be nice to lock the door downstairs too.)
- We made our own breakfast in the mornings but there's not a lot of supplies to make your own meals (1 skillet, 1 pot, no spatula, etc). This wasn't a huge issue either because we wanted to try all the good food on the island but if you're looking to cook your own meals, this could be an issue.
- The bed is great but takes up quite a bit of space in the room.
- No tv (again, not a big issue b/c we brought our laptop)
Overall, the apartment was great and so is Gerda. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Short walk to town which we did numerous times as well as walks to the relatives home and Tisbury School. Great location on the island for walking, handy if you don't have a car at about a 7 minute walk to the ferry landing. Weather was favorable between the storms, so walking as a great way to get around.
Ken and Fran were very accommodating to our needs, both in the delay getting on island as well as providing for the 14 month old grandchild with high chair, baby gate and crib.
Not sure when we will get back to the island as we travel from rural WA state, but we will have Vineyard Retreat at the top of the list.
